docs.lead_paragraph: Cholesterol-lowering drugs called statins, which have been shown to lower a person’s risk for heart attack, can also slightly increase a patient’s risk for developing diabetes, particularly at higher doses, new research shows.

headline.main: Cholesterol Drugs Linked With Diabetes Risk

docs.abstract: Cholesterol-lowering drugs called statins, which have been shown to lower a person’s risk for heart attack, can also slightly increase a patient’s risk for developing diabetes, particularly at higher doses.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Bloomberg administration says that by arresting more than 350,000 people for having small amounts of marijuana since 2002, the police have helped drive down serious crime -- and that the consequences for the people locked up have been minimal. Nearly 90 percent of those arrested on charges of personal possession of marijuana are black or Latino, although its use by young white people is rampant in affluent quarters of the city.

headline.main: Side Effects Of Arrests For Marijuana

docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column maintains that few of those arrested on marijuana charges actually end up with criminal convictions, but there are other, hidden consequences that are much worse; (M)
docs.snippet: The Bloomberg administration says that by arresting more than 350,000 people for having small amounts of marijuana since 2002, the police have helped drive down serious crime -- and that the consequences for the people locked up have been minimal.   ...

docs.lead_paragraph: Closing the Cordis division in the face of dwindling market share, the company expects to trim 900 to 1,000 jobs this year.
